content.title: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana
content.department: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying
content.beneficiary: Fishers, Fish Farmers, Fish Workers, Fish Vendors, Fisheries Development Corporations, Self Help Groups, Fisheries Cooperatives, Entrepreneurs
content.details: The scheme 'Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY)' was launched to bring about ecologically healthy, economically viable, and socially inclusive development of the fisheries sector of India. PMMSY shall bring about Blue Revolution through sustainable and responsible development of the fisheries sector in India at a total investment of ₹ 20,050 crore for holistic development of the fisheries sector including the welfare of fishers.
benefits: Assistance for marketing and export of fish products
eligibility: Self Help Groups (SHGs)/joint Liability Groups (JLGs) in the Fisheries Sector
documents_required: Partnership Deed or Memorandum of Association (MOA)

faqs.question: What Is PMMSY?
faqs.answer: The PMMSY is an umbrella scheme with two separate components namely (a) Central Sector Scheme (CS) and (b) Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS).

faqs.question: What Is The Duration Of PMMSY Scheme?
faqs.answer: PMMSY will be implemented in all the States and Union Territories for a period of 5(five) years from FY 2020-21 to FY 2024-25.

faqs.question: What Is The Funding Pattern For Central Sector Scheme?
faqs.answer: (a) The entire project/unit cost will be borne by the Central government (i.e. 100% central funding).

faqs.question: What Is The Funding Pattern For Non-Beneficiary Orientated Centrally Sponsored Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Non-beneficiary orientated sub-components/activities under CSS component to be implemented by the States/UTs, the entire project/unit cost will be shared between Centre and State.

faqs.question: Which Are The End Implementing Agencies (EIAs) In PMMSY?
faqs.answer: The PMMSY would be implemented through the Central Government and its entities, State/UT Governments and their entities, State Fisheries Development Boards, and any other End Implementing Agencies as decided by the Department of Fisheries.
